text:
Amid speculation over his absence in the ‘Saifai Mahotsav’, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav on Thursday attended the annual extravaganza and flagged off a cycle rally here.

The rally, from Kathmandu to Delhi, which stopped over at Saifai here, aims to create awareness on environment protection and women empowerment.

Speaking on the occasion, Mr. Akhilesh blamed the “State of Delhi” for increased pollution in Yamuna and said that it was the capital’s “responsibility to clean it”.

Earlier on Saturday, the Mahotsava had got off with fanfare but Mr. Akhilesh was conspicuous by his absence on the inaugural day, triggering speculation.

Though there was no official word from the Samajwadi Party or the government, sources in the ruling party said the Chief Minister, who is also the State president of the SP, was upset over the sacking of his two close associates - Sunil Yadav alias Sajan and Anand Bhadauria. Sajan was national president of SP Chhatrasabha, while Bhadauria was former national president of Lohia Vahini.

Another SP leader Subodh Yadav, son of party MLA from Etah Rameshwar Yadav, was also expelled on charges of indulging in anti-party activities. - PTI
title: Akhilesh ends speculation, attends ‘Saifai Mahotsav’
